channel.title: TGaceAllStories
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from TGaceAllStories, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Why CarMax’s stock tumbled, even as used-car prices rose for first time 2 years
item.description: CarMax’s stock having worst day since 2022 after profit misses expectations, long-term goals were put on hold given economic uncertainties.

item.title: Social Security’s COLA seen lower in 2026 as market turmoil leaves seniors in limbo
item.description: The cost-of-living adjustment for 2026 would be below the 20-year average and the 2025 figure.

item.title: Is the Nippon Steel bid dead? Here’s the latest as U.S. Steel’s stock plunges again.
item.description: “We don’t want it to go to Japan or any other place, and we’re working with them,” President Donald Trump said of U.S. Steel.

item.title: The stock market hasn’t beaten Trump’s tariffs yet. Here’s what investors should think about now.
item.description: Investors should reset their views about Trump’s priorities and goals during this 90-day trade war cease-fire.

item.title: There’s another big Treasury auction today and it will test investor demand amid tariff volatility

item.title: Tesla gets price target cut from three Wall Street shops
item.description: Mizuho's price target cut still implies Tesla stock could rise 38% from here, while UBS' new forecast is roughly 30% below the stock's Wednesday close...

item.title: NextNRG: The Fuel Behind the Fire

item.title: This restaurant software stock gets a double upgrade from Wells Fargo
item.description: Wells Fargo sees shares of Toast rising 13% from here.

item.title: Buy the dip on 'ad tech's best executor,' Morgan Stanley says
item.description: Analyst Matthew Cost upgraded the mobile ad company to overweight from equal weight.

item.title: Morgan Stanley stands by Nvidia as a top pick even though tariff turmoil is not over
item.description: The firm remains bullish on sustained AI spending and said Nvidia's "relative supply chain flexibility will help them outperform."

item.title: Here are Thursday's biggest analyst calls: Nvidia, Apple, Tesla, Microsoft, Roblox, Disney, Amazon, Deckers and more
item.description: Here are the biggest calls on Wall Street on Thursday.
